Mahmoud asked Ryada for this loan in order to paint his house and repair the ceiling to prevent the flowing of rain water. The repairs will give warmth for his family at home and reflects better living conditions. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and repair the ceiling to prevent the flowing of rain water.

loans.name: Bessi

texts.fr: Bessi, veuve de 48ans revend depuis 2003 des pagnes et boubous au marché de Lomé. Elle s'approvisionne au même lieu et distribue à ses clients. N'arrivant pas à mieux satisfaire ses derniers, elle sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le gain l'aidera à ouvrir une boutique et mieux prendre soin de ses 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Bessi, age 48, is a widow. Since 2003, she's been reselling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and boubous at the market in Lomé. She gets her supplies there, and distribute her products to her customers.

Unable to meet customer demand, she's seeking a first loan to buy more products. The profits will help her to open a shop and take better care of her two children.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and boubous

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina. She previously accessed an 33,000 PHP loan that she used for the maintenance of her video/karaoke machine. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 23,000 PHP loan for the maintenance of her video/karaoke machine. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelina hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of an abundant life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase parts and pay for the maintenance of her video/karaoke machine

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their own household.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Carolina owns and oversees the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts, accessories, and also for the maintenance of their tricycle. 

Carolina hopes to buy another unit of tricycle, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed supplies for her gardening business. She has had this business for twenty years now and it keeps on growing. Her loan is also used for the education of her child. As a widow, she works hard to provide for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets, and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Feliza hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy gardening materials, like wire, baskets, and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, 53 years old, is married and has five children, one of whom is still in school.

For the past 15 years, Tessie has operated a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Tessie has previously borrowed 15 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Tessie would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 59, and lives with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile shop for several years and earning sufficient income. Her son troubleshoots the mobile phones, sells the mobile accessories such as chargers, body, data cables, etc., and provides the recharge facilities for different networks. 

Nowadays there's a lot of demand for mobiles, accessories, and for recharge. But he does not have savings to further invest into the business, because he spends all his income on household expenses. 

Therefore, Suriya requested a loan for her son so that he can buy additional mobiles and accessories.

Suriya thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories to sell at her son's mobile shop

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed, a 39-year-old married woman, lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives rickshaw in Lahore city, which is a very populated area. Few days ago he got into a road accident; he was looking for the passenger standing beside the road, and a speedy car hit the rickshaw from behind. He did not get hurt, but the rickshaw body got seriously damaged and needs to be replaced with a new one. Her husband has some savings, but is short of finances to buy a new body for the auto rickshaw.

Therefore, Naheed requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy the body of auto rickshaw.

Naheed is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: To buy a new Rickshaw body.

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 25 years old. He is single. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is single but has two children whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cereal business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a cereal wholesale shop house in the near future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan she wants to purchase beans, maize, rice and wheat for sale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize, rice and wheat for sale in her business

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Около 2 лет Сафаргул в поте лица занимается растениеводством. Такая работа доставляет ей удовольствие. Она получает доход чисто нажитым трудом. И ей это нравиться. Сафаргул на орошаемой земле работает не одна, ей помогает ее сын и дочь. Им по 25 и 17 лет. Сафаргул мать пятерых детей (2 дочки и 3 сына). Другие дети учатся в школе. Старший сын Сафаргула женат. Его сын вместе с женой живет в родительском доме и помогает маме. Сафаргулу 42 года. Она очень рада, что у нее большая и дружная семья.
  Сафаргул занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она хочет по скорей реализовать посев до прихода зимы. Зима в Таджикистане приходит позднее чем в других странах и поэтому у нее еще есть шанс посадить зимний урожай. Но чтобы реализовать посев, у Сафаргул нет достаточной суммы денег. Она просит кредит с надеждой, что вы ей поможете купить семена и горючей смеси для трактора.
texts.en:
Safargul has been working hard in agriculture for about two years. It's an activity that gives her pleasure, as she receives income purely from her own labour, which she likes. Safargul doesn't work the land alone - her son and daughter, who are 25 and 17, help her. Safargul is the mother of five children - two daughters and three sons. The other children are in school. Her oldest son is married. His son and his wife live in his parents' house and help his mother. Safargul is 42. She is glad to have a big and happy family.

Safargul grows agricultural crops. She wants to sow her fields quickly, before winter arrives. Winter in Tajikistan comes later than in other countries and therefore she still has a chance to plant a winter harvest. But she doesn't have enough money to achieve this. She is requesting a loan with the hope that you will help her to buy seeds and tractor fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds and tractor fuel

loans.name: Baraka Nuru Group

texts.en:
Baraka is a Nuru International group of five farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge of improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm supplies. As a group, the members of Baraka collectively guarantee the loan.

Joseph, pictured with his hand raised, is a representative of the group. He is 26 years old and married with three children, two of whom go to school. He has been a member of this group since 2012. 

The loan from KIVA in this coming season will enable him to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizers which he believes will increase his farm yields. Joseph, just like other members of his group, will take loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre and sorghum and millet in ¼ acre each. Thus, he will obtain food for his household, sell the surplus and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 36 years old and lives with her nice family in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. Nora is married and she has a son. She lives with her husband, son and parents-in-law. Nora has a higher education with a specialty of historian. Now she works at the school as the head of the school library. 

As she says, she does her work with great pleasure and care, since everyday work with hundreds of books makes man wiser and kinder. She reads a lot, and she is ready to help any pupil find some interesting and nice books to read with pleasure. Nora’s husband also works, and together they try to provide their family with normal living conditions. 

Lately, their son has some dental problems and he needs to undergo treatments. Nora is asking for a loan of 170,000 Armenian drams in order to be able to pay for their son’s treatment course.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s course of treatments.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata, a 40-year-old from Waterloo 2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. In 2010, Aminata established her retail business because she wants to develop herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network within her operation area.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to open a big store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: francisca de 52 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, ella posee un negocio de venta de pescado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Francisca esta solicitando un credito para la compra de pescados por mayor para seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calodad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca is 52 years old and lives with her family in their own home. She has had a business selling fish in the market close to her house for several years. With what she makes from her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses. Francisca is requesting a loan to buy fish wholesale so she can continue with her business. She'd like to make more revenue to provide her family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Sylvie is 40 years old. She is married with seven children. She will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 46-year-old resident of Aden, Yemen. He is the father of two children and responsible for big family. He is an employee in the Ministry of Health getting low salary which is not enough to cover household expenses. Therefore, Khalid owns a taxi in order to increase his income. He started this business because there were originally no other people providing these services. His biggest difficulty is the competition, since several new taxi stands have been opening in the past few years. 

He requested a loan from AMB to buy spare parts to maintain his taxi and make good profits. That way, he'll continue to improve his family's living conditions and somehow ensure his children's education in university.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain his taxi and make good profits.

loans.name: Meruzhan

texts.en: Meruzhan was born and lives in Kapan city, which is in Syunik region. He lives with his wife and two little children. Merushan has a specialty of pedagogue and for several years he has worked at the school as a teacher of history. Unfortunately after some time he had to change his occupation in order to earn more money for his family, and he became engaged in clothes trading business. He rents a stall at the local wholesale market. He sells  men's clothes, shoes and boots. Now he needs to renew his stall’s clothes assortment and he also wants to buy winter boots for the coming cold season. He asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams for these purchases.

loans.use: to renew his stall’s clothes assortment and winter boots for reselling

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 55 years old and married with three children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosemarie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante por la diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Marta esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un prestamo para comprar ropa por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica junto con su familia.
texts.en: Marta lives in her own home with her husband and children. She sells clothing door-to-door in the various neighborhoods close to where she lives. With what she makes from her sales and with what her husband contributes she pays some of the household expenses. Marta is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy clothing wholesale. She wants to generate more revenue to enjoy a more stable financial situation with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad, es una madre soltera, la cual es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a sus dos hijas. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual sus hijas le ayudan a repartir las tortillas, sobre todo en los fines de semana. Maria desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobretodo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old. She is a single mother who is very responsible and who's first priority is bringing up her children. She sells tortillas which she takes orders for each midday and evening. Her business is located in her house and her children help her distribute the tortillas especially on weekends. 

Maria would really like to expand her business, as it is producing very stable revenues that allows her to support her family. So she is requesting a loan so she can buy corn wholesale and also buy lime. She plans to make a greater quantity of tortillas, especially on weekends. Demand booms then as many other tortilla shops are closed and she can make more profit which allows her to improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and buy lime.

loans.name: Victoriano Mariano

texts.es: Don victoriano desde hace varios años se dedica a la apicultura (elaboracion de miel de abeja)comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Victoriano esta solicitando un credito para la compra de azucar y colmenas para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Victoriano has worked in agriculture for various years, producing bee's honey. He sells his product in the various markets close to his residence. With his profits he manages to pay some of the household expenses. Victoriano is requesting a loan to buy sugar and beehives to continue with his work. This is his only source of income and doing it he can offer his family a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar and beehives.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Khady, est une femme battante qui veut réaliser son rêve le plus cher : celui de construire sa propre maison. Elle est employée dans un hôtel comme valet de chambre depuis quelques années. Ayant acquis un terrain, elle décide de solliciter un crédit pour construire petit à petit sa maison. Avec les 200000F CFA, elle pourra entamer les travaux de fondement et quand elle l’aura soldé, elle pourra renouveler pour élever, ainsi de suite, voilà son programme.
Khady est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants dont elle a la charge. C’est avec son salaire qu’elle s’occupe de soit et de ses enfants.
Elle pense que si elle s’active dans le commerce, elle pourra mettre un peu plus d’argent de coté et accélérer la construction.
texts.en:
Mrs Khady is a real fighter! She wants to fulfill her dearest dream: to build her own house. She's been working as a servant in a hotel for a few years.

Having bought a land lot, she decided to seek a loan in order to build her home little by little. With her loan, she will be able to start building the foundation. After repaying the loan, she will be able to get another one to start construction, and so on: this is her plan.

Khady is divorced and the mother of two children, who are in her care. With her income, she provides for herself and her children. She thinks that if she becomes a merchant, she will be able to put a little more money away, and speed up the construction of her home.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement, in order to start construction on her land lot

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a student of Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City studying Business Administration. She is determined to finish her studies and find a job in the future to help her family. Her previous loans were used for the school needs and allowances. This semester, she requests a new loan from GDMPC to be used for school materials and additional uniforms and charges. She wants to be successful in her future and be able to help the family to improve their living.

loans.use: pay for school materials and additional uniforms and charges

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 54 years old and married with three children.

Verginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like candies, biscuits, snack foods, candles, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell. Verginia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Verginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like candies, biscuits, snack foods, candles, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 69 years old. He is a father of two children. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 58 años de edad vive con su madre en casa propia, tiene un hijo pero ya no vive con ella pero le ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos. Margarita es muy dedicada en su trabajo, está dispuesta a esforzarse por su trabajo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo. Margarita tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Margarita is 58 years old. She lives with her mother in her own home. She has a son who no longer lives with her but who helps her with the household expenses. She makes tortillas in her home and has many years experience in this business. She has gained many clients as her service is excellent and she is very friendly with the people who come to visit. She always has a smile for them. 

Margarita is very dedicated to her work. She is ready exert herself. So she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will permit her to buy corn wholesale so she can continue her production. Margarita hopes that by doing this she can provide her family with a steady financial situation.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con sus hijos y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda en el negocio, desde hace 3 años tomo la decisión de poner un puesto de venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, carteras, peluches, etc. en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene  mucha clientela fija que la busca por sus buenos productos y a precios muy accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos en su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: This 25 year old client lives in a relative's house with her children and her life's companion, who helps with the business. Three years ago, she decided to open a stall selling men's and women's underwear, wallets, stuffed animals, etc., in the market close to her residence. It has gone very well for her, since she has a lot of regular customers who seek her out for her good products and very accessible prices. With the profits she earns she is able to pay for some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale and continue with her business. It is her only source of employment and this way she can give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's underwear, wallets, stuffed animals, etc., wholesale.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia tiene 7 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias,es muy reconocido por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, el quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como golosinas, granos basicos, aceite, arroz, azucar, refrescos, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Carlos is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has had a store in his residence for 7 years. He has lots of experience as to which sales provide the best profit. He is well-known by the neighbors in his area. He has gained many clients as his store is well-stocked. He wants to expand his business and make a new investment. But he needs capital so he is requesting a loan to allow him to buy what is needed for his store like sweets, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks etc. He is certain he can pay off his debt and trusts that this will provide his family with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 24 years old. He works as accountant, and he lives in Aja village at Jinen. Aja village is a Palestinian town in Jenin city in the northern West Bank, located 19 kilometers southwest of Jenin. According to the Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics, the town had a population of 5,055 in 2007. 

Mohammad asked Ryada for this loan in order to paint his house and repair the windows, which will help him to take step forward. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and repair the windows.

loans.name: Monna

texts.en: Monna wants to be an accountant someday. She is still studying and her determination to have a better future makes her passion enjoyable. Her previous loans from GDMPC was used for her school materials and expenses. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to be used for school materials and other charges for the second semester this school year. She hopes to get a job after finishing her studies and to be able to help her parents improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for school materials and other charges

loans.name: Shirimo

texts.ru: Ширимо проживает в районе Яван. Она 56-летняя вдова, имеющая троих детей. У Ширимо высшее педагогическое образование, но в данный момент она занимается шитьем. Она начала свое швейное дело три года тому назад. Ширимо берет заказы на шитьё национальных платьев, а также курпа и курпача (национальные стеганные ватные одеяла). Она шьет на очень старой машинке, так как у нее нет другой машинки и в процессе работы это ей причиняет неудобства. Ширимо хочет расширить свое дело и с этой целью запрашивает кредит. Она планирует купить профессиональную швейную машинку вместе со столиком и стулом. За счет прибыли с деятельности Ширимо хочет выдать замуж свою младшую дочь.
texts.en:
Shirimo resides in the Yavan region. She is a 56-year-old widow with three children. Shirimo has a higher pedagogical education, but currently she is engaged in sewing. She began her sewing work three years ago. Shirimo takes orders for sewing national dresses, and also "kurpa" and "kurpacha" (national quilted mattresses).

She sews on a very old machine, since she does not have another machine and in the process of her work this becomes uncomfortable. Shirimo wants to expand her work and with this aim is requesting a loan. She plans to buy a professional sewing machine along with a table and chair.

With the income from the activities, Shirimo wants to giver her younger daughter away in marriage.

loans.use: to purchase a professional sewing machine together with a table and chair

loans.name: Dominique

texts.en:
Dominique is 46 years old. He is married and has five children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 29 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have been farmers for the past two years. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for 4 years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has two children.  

She began her business because she wants to improve her status of living. In 2011, Aminata established her general stock business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loans. In the future, Aminata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 56-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and daughter in the small village of Sachkhere district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and small plot of agricultural land. Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest. They always have high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. Manana decided to start dairy farming and seek for credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts was unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1100 Gel for purchasing a cow.  After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They will also use the milk products to feed the family. The new business initiative will give Manana chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Eliza from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 5 children. She began her business because she wants to improve her status of living. In 2008, Eliza established her snack business. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Eliza requires a loan in order to purchase more cow meat and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Sarah plans to own the biggest restaurant in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cow meat and cooking seasonings to expand her business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 41 years old and lives in the town of Dansoman in the region of greater-Accra in Ghana. She is single and has no child. For the past 7 years, Hannah has been working hard to manage her foodstuff shop. To help expand her business, Hannah has requested a loan of GHS 1,500 from ID-Ghana. The loan will be used for business expansion and to buy one box of tomatoes, one bag of cassava, and yams for sale in the Christmas festivity period. This will help Hannah to generate greater profits so that she can save more. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up more shops.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for sale in the Christmas festivity period.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria de 31 años de edad vive ne casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maiz, frijoles, hárinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es una mujer  emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, esta trabajando muy duro todos los días para no decepcionar a su familia, se siente satisfecha y muy cómoda con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio y su molino ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 31 years old. She lives in her own home with her family. She works at her mill, processing all types of food, such as corn, beans, flours, sauces, and more. She has been in this business for some time and she has a lot of experience that helps her generate very good profits. She is very well known to the people in the area and she has gained a lot of customers who prefer her because of the quality, the accessible prices, and the unequaled service  always available to the customers. She is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work. She is working very hard every day so she won't disappoint her family. She feels very satisfied and comfortable in her business. In the last few weeks demand has increased for the service and her mill and she can't meet the demand. That is why she has asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy a new mill to work. She has good payment references and she is responsible. She is committed to paying off the debt and she also has faith that she will bring financial and emotional security to her family.

loans.use: to buy a new mill.

loans.name: José Bacilio

texts.es: Don josé de 63 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa y dos hijos, y quienes le ayudan en el trabajo, desde hace 10 años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos, así mismo hace tejas, las cuales se utilizan para poner en los techos, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de sus productos, Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar cemento por mayor, así mismo comprar todas las herramientas necesarias para la elaboración de dicho trabajo, y asi obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 63 years old. He lives in his own home with his family which is composed of his wife and two children. They help him with his work. For 10 years he has been making and selling bricks. He also makes tiles which are used for roofing. He has a lot of clients due to the quality of his product.

José is requesting a loan so he can buy cement wholesale and also buy all the tools needed for production of this product. Then he can generate better income and provide his family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy cement wholesale and buy raw materials for making bricks and tiles.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina se ha caracterizado por ser una joven activa y emprendedora, a sus 23 años de edad ha tenido experiencia laboral como vendedora, inicialmente trabajó en un supermercado por el lapso de un año, luego consiguió su empleo actual en un almacén en el que lleva 4 meses, así ha generado ingresos para solventar sus necesidades básicas. Con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos para apoyar a su familia económicamente; desea iniciar de manera alterna e independiente con la venta de mercancía; razón por la cual se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito; con el dinero comprará mercancía al por mayor como ropa y accesorios de bisutería para dama; así podrá comenzar con su nuevo proyecto productivo, con el que espera generar muy buenos resultados a nivel económico.
Lina manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder tener un negocio que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para independizarse totalmente y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de su familia y el bienestar.
texts.en:
Lina has been described as and active and enterprising young women. At 23 years old, she has had work experience as a salesperson. She started working in a supermarket for a year. Later, she obtained her present job at a store where she has been for four years. This is how she has earned income to pay for her basic needs. In order to add to the income to support her family financially, she wants to start an alternative and independent activity by selling merchandise. That is why she is motivated to ask for the help of a loan. With the money, she will buy merchandise wholesale, such as clothing and women's jewelry accessories. This way, she will be able to start with her new productive project, with which she hopes to generate good financial results.  

Lina says that her biggest wish is to be able to have a business that will guarantee favorable financial stability she she can become totally independent and thus improve her family's quality of life and well being little by little.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale, such as clothing and women's jewelry.

loans.name: A.j Group

texts.en:
Bautista is the featured borrower of A.j group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have been friends since they arrived in Lebanon to work as housekeepers in order to support their beloved families back home in the Philippines.

Bautista is a 43-year-old married mother of two children who works as a housekeeper to financially support her beloved family in the Philippines. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Her acquired loan will be sent to her beloved family back in the Philippines to enjoy the Christmas spirit and to try to make up to her children because she isn't next to them and capable of taking good care of them since she has to work hard to provide them the necessary standard of living.

Bautista is the first on the right side of the picture; as for the other group members, Jasmin is standing in the middle, and Joan is the first on the left.

loans.use: to send funds to her children back home in the Philippines for Christmas.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 60 years old and a farmer from a rural area of Baray, Kampong Thom. She is a widowed mother of four children, all of whom are married and engaged in farming. Chan has been doing mixed farming for over 25 years. Her daily income right now is KHR 10,000.

As of now, Chan is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva lenders in order to renovate her home because it has deteriorated for years. She will hire laborers to perform the construction and buy the supplies needed for the construction. Chan is very happy because her loan will be approved to enable her to improve her home. This can allow everyone in her family to live in a comfortable way.

loans.use: to hire laborers to perform the construction and to buy the supplies needed for the construction.

loans.name: Eliza Jane

texts.en:
Eliza Jane wants to be an accountant in the future. She is studying for a BS in Accountancy at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. Her previous loan was used for her allowances. 

She requests a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to be used for her additional school fees and allowances for this school year. Eliza Jane wants to finish her studies and become successful, so that she would be able to help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her additional school fees and allowances.

loans.name: Ilodomiri

texts.en:
Ilodomiri is 33 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. Carmen is married and has a bread vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Carmen requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bread to sell.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is 40 years old, from Waterloo2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with five children.  

In 2007, Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted improve her family's standard of living. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems in her operation area.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more equipment, to expand her stove business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare and to increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to change her business to a clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment, to expand her stove business.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la venta de sorbetes y paletas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, posee mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, luis esta solicitando a integral un credito para la compra de paletas y sorbetes por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y tener aun mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Luis, 36, lives in his own house with his wife and his three children.  He makes a living selling sorbet and ice pops.  His business is located in his home, but he also sells on foot in different neighborhoods.

Luis has a lot of customers because his product is profitable.  He's able to cover some of his household expenses with what he earns.

He's requesting a loan from Integral to buy ice pops and sorbet wholesale so he can keep on working and have even better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy ice pops and sorbet wholesale

loans.name: Sandra Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Sandra vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo, ella es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Doña Sandra solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Sandra lives in her own home with her husband and son. She is a very responsible and hardworking mother; she has succeeded in getting her family ahead. She owns a store that sells food products, such as bread, soft drinks, oils, vegetables, fruits, and candy, as well as essential items like soap and shampoo, among others. She runs her store from her own home. Sandra is applying for a loan through which she will be able to further stock her store so she can better serve her customers. In this manner, she can increase her sales which is her priority in order to move her family forward.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, oils, vegetables, fruits, candy, soap, shampoo, and so forth.

loans.name: Jheison Fernando

texts.es:
Jheison es un joven activo y dinámico que sueña con ser propietario de una fábrica de refrescos y agua en presentación de bolsas; para ello lucha incansablemente mientras trabaja como vendedor en una empresa donde fabrican estos productos y los distribuyen en diferentes barrios del municipio donde reside; así ha aprendido de la labor y ha adquirido experiencia en el manejo del negocio; esto lo impulsa a tomar la decisión de independizarse y por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito; con el dinero comprará una moto con carga y productos empacados (agua y refrescos) con el ánimo de comenzar a distribuir por cuenta propia en los diferentes municipios de la región, aprovechando que las temperaturas de la zona son bastante elevadas, por lo que dichos productos son de primera necesidades entre los habitantes; facilitando así la venta de los mismos.
Jheison es consciente que para lograr los resultados que espera, debe trabajar con empeño, disciplina y mucha dedicación; así podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño en un futuro a mediano o largo plazo; y poco a poco podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida propias y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jheison is young, active, and dynamic. He dreams of owning his own drink and water factory—products that would be sold in bags. To achieve this, he works tirelessly while also working as a vendor in a business that makes these products and distributes them to different neighborhoods in his town. He has learned from this job and gained experience in business management.

This convinced him to make the decision to become independent and request a loan. With the money, he will buy a motorcycle along with cargo and packaged products (water and drinks) so he can start to distribute to different towns in the region on his own. He will take advantage of the temperatures in the area, which are high. For this reason, his products are necessities for those who live here, making sales of these products easier.

Jheison understands that in order to achieve the results he wants, he has to work hard and be disciplined and dedicated. This will allow him to advance to reach his dream in the future, and little by little, he will improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle along with cargo and packaged products (water and drinks).

loans.name: Rda

texts.en:
Rda is a hardworking youth client from Iraq. He is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents and his two brothers. Rda, his father and his two brothers provide the family income together.

Rda owns a shop where he sells clothes for women as well as cosmetics and perfumes. He has been in this field since 2010 and has gained much experience in this field and an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.

Rda is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to to install a rolling shutter, a display window and an external ceiling for his shop. Rda is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself a good career and a bright future.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, a display window and an external ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Kemandazi Group

texts.en:
This group of six farmers is called Kemandazi. It is a group of Nuru International farmers and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Jane, raising up her hand, is 40 years old. She is married and was blessed with five children who all go to school. She fully depends on subsistence agriculture. She has been a member of this group for two years now and is the group’s chairperson.

Jane is asking for a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which is one way of implementing better farming methods that she has learnt through her group. She believes this will lead to increased yields. When she gets good yields of sorghum, millet and maize during the harvest of 2014 long rains, she will be able to provide enough food for her family and sell the surplus. The money she gets from the surplus will be spent in investing in a business that will increase income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Conchita 2 Group

texts.es:
Conchita 2 es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 7 personas, cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica la cual desarrollan con el objetivo de ganarse la vida y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de Tres Valles en el cual las principales actividades económicas son el cultivo de piña y caña de azúcar. 
Rubén es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, estudió la preparatoria, esta casado y tiene dos hijos, él platica que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia pero desde hace 4 años inició a vender productos naturistas y dulces de manera ambulante. Todos los días sube sus productos a su triciclo y sale a poner su negocio frente a una tienda departamental, comenta que hasta ahora ha vendido bien y siempre tiene una sonrisa para sus clientes. Un crédito le ayudará a comprar variedad de dulces y medicamentos naturistas para resurtir su negocio. Él espera que  con este crédito su negocio prospere y pueda brindar a su familia una mejor cálida de vida. Los demás integrantes de grupo son: Gaudencio cría de cerdos, Macario albañilería, Lucía venta de antojitos , Amado venta de ropa, Jorge venta de abarrotes y Javier panadería.
texts.en:
Conchita 2 is the name of the group made up of seven members, each one of whom has a job with the objective of earning a living and improving their families' lives.  This group is located in the town of Tres Valles, where the main work is growing pineapple and sugar cane.

Rubén is one of the members of the group.  He completed college prep.  He's married and has two children.  He says he always has worked very hard to get his family ahead.  Four years ago Rubén started selling natural medicines and sweets as a street vendor.  He puts his products on his tricycle every day and goes out to set up his business in front of a department store.  He says that he has sold well up to now and that he always has a smile for his customers.

A loan will help Rubén buy a variety of sweets and natural medicines to restock his business.  He hopes his business will prosper with this loan and he'll be able to give his family a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are Gaudencio, who raises pigs; Macario, who works in construction; Lucía, who sells snacks; Amado, who sells clothing; Jorge, who sells groceries, and Javier, who has a bakery.

loans.use: to buy sweets and natural medicines

loans.name: Gisela Del Pilar

texts.es:
Gisela del Pilar tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida seco de chavelo, arroz con pato, cabrito entre otros, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de insumos carne, sacos arroz, para preparar sus platos y para la compra de azúcar, maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gisela del Pilar is 25 years old. She lives together with her husband and children in the district of La Matanza, a tranquil community whose people are in agriculture, trade, and livestock for a living. It is two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Perú.

She is in the sale of foods like seco de chavelo (a dry curried beef), rice with duck, and goat, among others. She has requested a loan of $375 to invest in the purchase of supplies such as meat and bags of rice to prepare dishes. It is also for the purchase of sugar and corn to make chincha de jora, a type of beverage, and in this way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, flour, and rice to prepare food.

loans.name: Frauritte

texts.fr: Frauritte est une femme de 36 ans, célibataire et mère de 4 enfants. Elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des produits cosmétiques et les mèches afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses ventes et profits. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son capital et permettre de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Frauritte, age 36, is single and the mother of four children. She's been owning and running a hair salon in one neighborhood of the city for three years.

She's seeking this loan to bolster her stock of products, by buying cosmetics and hair extensions, in order to better satisfy her clientele and increase her sales and profits.

Her profits will be in part reinvested in her woking capital, and in part used to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Pauline Pascale

texts.fr: Pauline est une femme de 25 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. elle possède et gère un atelier de couture dans un quartier de la ville depuis 1 an. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des 40 tissus pagnes et un mélange de tissus en soie afin de satisfaire toute sa clientèle et augmenter ses profits. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son activité (achat de 2 machines à coudre) et permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline, age 25, is single and without children. For one year, she's been owning and running a sewing workshop in a neighborhood of the city.

She's seeking this loan to bolster her stock, by buying 40 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and a mix of silk fabrics in order to satisfy all her clientele and increase her profits.

Her profits will be reinvested in her business (purchase of two sewing machines) and also enable her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Reina Victoria

texts.es: Reina de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Reina es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Reina tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Reina, 44, lives in her own house with her family.  She's an enterprising woman who's committed to her job and very much wants to get ahead.  She's always looking for ways to be successful.

Reina makes a living buying and selling strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, and other fruits and vegetables.  She has had the business for several years and it has given her a lot of experience in sales, which allows her to earn the best profits.  She sells in a strategic location that's crowded with people.  A lot of customers prefer her because her products are fresh, affordable, and high quality, and her service is excellent.

Demand has increased in the past few weeks and Reina wants to make the most of it and make a new investment.  She doesn't have enough capital, however, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale.

Reina has a good payment record.  She's grateful for the support and is certain she'll be able to repay the debt.  She also trusts she'll give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Roobie Rouze

texts.en:
Roobie Rouze is studying BS - Information Technology at Misamis University. She is 22 years old and is determined to finish her studies and be able to help her parents and their community. 

Roobie Rouze joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and is borrowing a loan to pay for the school tuition fees. She is thankful to GDMPC for helping students to pursue ambitions for a better future. She wants to be successful in her life.

loans.use: to pay for her school tuition fees.

loans.name: Kimeng's Group

texts.en:
Kimeng is 49 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom attend school. She is from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her family, she and her husband operate a rice and maize farm. She works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She earns about 27,500 KHR per day. 

Kimeng is requesting her second loan from VisionFund in order to support her existing business. She is in a group composing of two borrowers who are requesting 1,400,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her loan to pay the reaping fee for her rice. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee for her rice

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru: Шамсиддин житель города Душанбе. Ему 36 лет. Он занимается животноводством и птицеводством. Шамсиддин работает в этой области более 3 лет. Ему в деятельности помогает жена. У Шамсиддина трое детей. Они уже ходят в школу. Шамсиддин сейчас нуждается в кредите. Он хочет увеличить количество птиц для откорма и продажи. Для этой цели он обратился за кредитом. Шамсиддин в основном занимается выращиванием индюков и кредит берет естественно для купли индюков и корма для птиц. Он обычно закупает индюков с других сёл и районов. Шамсиддину нравится его бизнес, так как он любит животных и птиц.
texts.en: Shamsiddin is a resident of Dushanbe. He is 36 years old. He is a livestock and poultry producer, and has been working in this sphere for over three years. His wife helps with the work. Shamsiddin has three children, who are all already in school. Shamsiddin needs a loan. He wants to increase the number of birds he has for feeding and sale. To reach this goal he is asking for a loan. Shamsiddin mostly raises turkeys, and is naturally asking for a loan to buy turkeys and food for the birds. He usually buys turkeys from other villages and areas. Shamsiddin likes his business because he loves animals and birds.

loans.use: Buy turkeys and bird food

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad vive en casa apropia con su hijo, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende Productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. Ella busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc.  lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Ana, 42, lives in her own home with her son. She has a small store where she sells perishable goods such as soft drinks, candy, and other types of food and non-food products. She has gotten her family ahead through this business. She is seeking to improve her quality of life; for this reason, she is applying for a loan to increase her product variety such as basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and so forth. This will allow her to increase her store's profits and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grains, soft drinks, candy, and so on.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre trabajador y pujante de 31 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 5 años al que ha sacado adelante trabajando arduamente para darle lo mejor.
Durante su vida productiva se dedicó por muchos años a manejar taxi, pero cansado de la misma rutina y de estar expuesto a tantos peligros, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de comidas hace aproximadamente 6 meses, tiene la ventaja de que el local donde está ubicado es propio, trabaja todos los días de 6 a 10 pm y ha tenido muy buena acogida por parte de la comunidad que habita en el sector; así ha logrado generar ingresos de manera independiente y además puede pasar más tiempo con su pequeño hijo.
El crédito lo solicita como un apoyo para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, pues con el dinero comprará una plancha y una freidora, sillas y mesas, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen de su negocio, además podrá ofrecer comodidad y aumentar su carta para deleitar los diferentes gustos de sus comensales; esto le dará impulso para aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe como ganancias.
Carlos tiene como propósito a mediano plazo, hacer de su negocio un restaurante reconocido en el sector, que le permita garantizar una estabilidad económica para brindar a su hijo una excelente educación y ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hardworking and vigorous man of 31, the father of a 5-year old son whom he has brought up, working arduously to give him the best.

During his productive life, he worked for many years driving a taxi, but tired of the same routine and being exposed to so many dangers, he decided to start his own food business about 6 months ago. It has the advantage that the he owns the place where he works. He works every day, from 6 am to 10 pm and he has had a very good welcome on the part of the community that lives in the area. In this way, he has achieved generating income in an independent manner and, in addition, he can spend more time with his small son.

The loan he is applying for is for support to continue strengthening his business. With the money he will buy a griddle and a fryer, chairs and tables. This will let him improve the image of his business. Additionally, he will be able to offer comfort and increase his menu to delight the different tastes of his diners; this will build momentum to increase his sales and the income that he receives as profit.

As a medium-term goal, Carlos plants to make his business a restaurant known in the area that permits him to guarantee economic stability to provide an excellent education for his son and offer better living conditions and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a griddle and a fryer, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is 29 years old, from Waterloo2, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married, with two children.  

In 2012, Kadiatu established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase bags of coal, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of coal, to expand her business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral pollos, patos y cerdos, en su domicilio luego de engordarlos los ofrece a un mejor precio en el mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la compra de calamina para arreglo de su techo y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Filomena is 69-years-old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun. The people in her district work in agriculture, trade, and ranching two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising poultry animals such as chickens, ducks, and pigs. At her residence, she fattens them up and offers them at a better price in the market in the area. She is asking a loan of 1,000 new soles to buy animal feed to fatten her animals and secondly so that she can buy corrugated sheet metal to fix her roof so that she has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and corrugated sheet metal to fix her roof.

loans.name: Al-Saeedah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Saeedah and it consists of three women, who have been operating different businesses.  They live in Aden, Yemen and are requesting a loan of 210,000 YER. 

Lolah is the leader of group.  She is 44 years old and the mother of six children, who live together in Aden, Yemen. She is enthusiastic about selling clothes, incense and perfumes to her female customers.  She believes that business has been going so well because she is very friendly and is well known. Due to the bad situation in Yemen, her business is currently bringing in less profit. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy additional goods such as ladies' clothing, incense, and perfumes. This will allow her to offer a greater variety to her customers and increase her income, helping her to work toward getting more profit and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional goods such as ladies' clothing, incense, and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Sameth's Group

texts.en:
Sameth is 41 years old and has four children, three of whom attend school. She is a local farmer living in Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province.  In addition to rice farming, she works for others for a fee and tailors clothes for additional income. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 15,800 KHR per day and save 4,800 KHR after deducting the necessary expenses. 

Sameth is requesting her third loan from VisionFund. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to upgrade her standard of living.  For this loan, she leads a group of two. She and her co-borrower are requesting 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan to buy potash for her crops. She hopes that her crop will return a good yield so that she can gain double income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru:
Это Шарифа с города Кургантюбе. Она занимается торговлей. Ей 47 лет, она замужем, имеет четверых детей школьного возраста. Три года назад Шарифа вместе с мужем открыли магазин, где они продают продукты питания и хозяйственные товары. Сегодня их торговля идет хорошо и за этот промежуток времени они приобрели своих постоянных клиентов. Шарифа обслуживает каждого своего клиента быстро и качественно. Все довольны ее обслуживанием. 
В данный момент запасы товаров в их магазине заканчиваются и им необходимо привезти новый товар, чтобы не потерять клиентов в этой конкурентной среде. В связи с этим Шарифа запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести ассортимент продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en: This is Sharifa from the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is a shopkeeper. She is 47 years old, married, and has four school-age children. Three years ago Sharifa and her husband opened a store where they sell groceries and household goods. Today their sales are going well and they've won regular customers during this period of time. Sharifa serves each customer quickly and well. Everyone is satisfied with her service. Currently the store is running out of stock and they need to bring in new goods so that they don't loose customers in a competitive environment. To do this Sharifa is asking for a loan to buy a range of new grocery and household products. She waits for your support.

loans.use: To buy grocery and household items

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора заботливая мать 2 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Она с трудом вырастила своих детей, так как ее муж давно бросил их и женился на другой женщине. Гулнора уже более 11 лет занимается купле продажей детской одежды. Гулнора торгует на местном рынке. Гулнора старается обновить ассортимент своего товара каждый сезон и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Гулнора запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. С полученного дохода она собирается улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnora is the caring mother of two grown children. Raising her children was difficult because her husband left them early on and married another woman. Gulnora has been selling children's clothing at the local market for over 11 years. She tries to renew her inventory with each season and thus attract more customers. She is asking for a 7000 somoni loan for the next season. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your compassion. She plans to use the income earned from use of the loan to improve her standard of living. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира жизнерадостная женщина. Она разведенная и имеет 2 детей. Она сама вырастила с большим трудом своих детей. Замира окончила университет искусства. Она много лет работала в театре как актриса. Данное время она занимается предоставлением услуги ведущей в различных мероприятиях и на свадьбах. Она вместе со своими детьми живет в старом доме. Замира хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zamira is a spirited woman. She is divorced and has two children. She raised them on her own with great difficulty. Zamira graduated from college with an art degree. She worked for many years in the theater as an actress. Currently she is providing master of ceremony services at various functions and weddings. She lives with her children in an aging house. She wants to make repairs to the house, but does not have enough money. She is asking for a 5000 somoni loan to buy building materials including cement and lumber. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for house repairs

loans.name: Ninfa Del Rocio

texts.es:
