Peter is a member of Boresha Group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The field officer is also included in the photo, standing on the left. The group leaders represent a total of 68 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Peter has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right, with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 (shillings) for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.	
						
Peter is married and has ten children. He is 70 years old and is known as friendly, hard-working, reliable,  trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community, in groups such as the men's group, prayer group, and burial committee. Peter has been a farmer for 30 years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year, by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  

Peter first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2008 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Peter joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough money to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Peter plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Peter’s own life was improved because he has more profits from the harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and he was able to save money and feed the family.  
		
Peter and the Boresha Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to access hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.es: Betsy, de 30 años, es una mujer optimista y muy trabajadora, ama mucho a la familia que formó con su conviviente, fruto de su amor tiene tres hijos menores que le impulsan a ser cada día mejor, vive en su casa propia con toda su familia que construyó en el terreno de su mamá y todos los días se levanta con muchas ganas de hacer las cosas bien para mejorar su condición de vida. El trabajo de Betsy consiste en la venta de comida. A diario elabora los mejores y más ricos platos regionales que deleitan el paladar de sus clientes. Su horario de trabajo empieza a las 7 de la mañana con la compra de todos los ingredientes que necesita, con todo ello prepara los platos durante el día hasta que empieza su horario de atención al cliente al culminar la tarde. Su puesto de venta está ubicado en la vereda de su casa, ahí instala un par de mesas, una cocina y todo lo que ha preparado para ofrecer a sus clientes. Lleva en este negocio más de 07 años y lo hace con ayuda de su mamá. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente cómoda ya que es independiente y dispone del tiempo que desea. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos tales como arroz, verduras y carnes.
texts.en:
Betsy, who is 30 years old, is an optimistic, hardworking woman. She loves the family that she has built with her partner. Together, they have three young children who inspire her to improve herself each day. She lives with her family in her own home, which they built on her mother's land. Each day, she wakes up with a desire to do things well so that she can improve her quality of life.

Betsy sells food for a living. Every day, she makes the most delicious regional dishes that delight her customers' palates. Her workday begins at 7 am, when she purchases all of the ingredients that she needs. With these ingredients, she cooks all day until it is time to tend to her customers at the end of the afternoon. She sells the food from the sidewalk at her house. Here, she has a couple of tables, a stove, and everything that she prepares for her customers.

She has been working in this business for more than seven years, and she is assisted by her mother. She likes her job because she likes to be independent and make her own schedule. 

At this time, she is requesting 500 nuevos soles. She is thankful for the opportunity and for the trust that lenders have placed in her so that she can receive this loan. She also promises to make her payments on time.

With this loan, she will purchase supplies and ingredients like rice, vegetables, and meat.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Gregoria Catarina

texts.es: La  señora Gregoria Catarina  de 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos (una de 8 y uno de 3 años) se dedica a la venta de jabón hace más de 1 año y medio (jabones, pastas, canastas, bancos, cepillos, shampoo, etc.) vende de forma ambulantemente en distintos pueblos los días de mercado, ella solicita un crédito para comprar más mercadería y poder surtir mejor su negocio, ya en esta temporada ella  logra incrementar más sus ventas y tiene mayor demanda por la temporada.  Su meta  es poder lograr tener  un ahorro para  darles estudios a sus hijos y puedan tener un mejor futuro ya que es un ingreso que ella posee para  ayudar, también lograr construir y mejorar su casa para su  familia y contribuir con los gastos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Gregoria Catarina, who is 28 years old, has 2 children (one who is 8 years old, and one who is 3 years old). She has sold soap for more than one and a half years (soaps, toothpaste, baskets, benches, brushes, shampoo, etc.). She makes her sales by walking on foot in various towns on their market days.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise so that she can stock her business better. This season, she hopes to increase her sales. She has had more demand this season. 

Her goal is to be able to save enough money to send her children to school so that they can have a better future. She would also like to build and improve her family's home and pay for some of her family's household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, toothpaste, baskets, benches, brushes, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres San Juaneras Group

texts.es:
DUO  MUJERES SAN JUANERAS
Doña Claudia quien sigue como  distribuidora de los productos Onmilife,  gracias a los conocimientos que ella  adquirido en esta empresa puede ayudar a varias personas quienes consumen este producto, es por eso que en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas productos medicinal natural, para poder vender y superarse un poco mas ya que con el credito anterior fue muy puntual en su pagos y no cayo en mora espera que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el creditos solicitado.
texts.en:
Two Women of San Juan
Doña Claudia has long been an Omnilife products distributor and she has many regular customers now.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with the natural medicines that she sells.  The investment will allow her to continue her business and live just a little bit better than before.  She repaid past loans on time, never falling behind, and hopes that you will be willing to help her with this new loan application.

loans.use: to stock her natural medicines business.

loans.name: Rayza Valeska Yessenia (1)

texts.es:
Rayza es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella trabaja como empleada del hogar y con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo solventa los gastos de sus estudios, ya que actualmente ella se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Biología en la universidad de su ciudad. 

Rayza gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar materiales para sus estudios, y de esta manera desempeñarse mejor, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Rayza is young and ambitious.  She is studying for a degree in biology at a local university and working as a cleaner in order to pay her expenses. 

Rayza says that she is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and that she will use their loans to pay for study materials.  The investment will allow her to continue working towards her great goal: "To finish my degree and embark on a career".

loans.use: to pay for study materials.

loans.name: Maraj

texts.en:
Maraj is 42 years old and married.  She has been running a business selling animals for many years, with the support of her husband. 

She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up, and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 46-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make sure her store is fully stocked, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000, which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

 She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She wishes to use part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of selling cloths for about four years. 

Salma buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base, and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Rossadeic's Group

texts.en:
Nancy, who is in her early 30s, is married to a driver called Eric, and they have three school-going children. 

For seven years now, she has been selling smoked fish at the market. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. each working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Nancy's third loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana. She used her previous loans to expand her portfolio by starting this fish business. She has managed to repay back all her previous loans successfully. 

Nancy useds her business profit to cover school fees and household expenses and reinvested some back to her business. She will use this loan to increase stock of her business. 

She dreams of opening a shop selling tailoring materials in addition to selling fish. 

Nancy will share this total loan amount of GHS 6,950 with her loan group “Rossadeic,” which consists of 11 members who hold one another accountable for repaying back the loan.  They will invest in the sale of eggs, cooking oil, slippers, provisions, and smoked fish .

loans.use: To buy one carton of fish, smoke the fish, and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 38-year-old vigorous married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata.  She is 45 years old and from the Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married, with four children.  

In 2010, Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to develop herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m.  until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is a poor network within her operating area.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more rice, onions, and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings to expand her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a business lady, and she deals in cereals. 

She has been doing this business for the past five years, and the business is fine. 

She wants to buy a stock of maize beans and green-grams. She knew Milango through friends who asked her to join so she could access funding for her business. The major challenges she faces in the business are price changes and inflation effects.

She hopes that in the next five years she will be able to open more branches of her business. The income that she will raise will improve her living standards and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of maize beans and green-grams.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is 35 years old and married, the mother of three children. 

She has been running a business selling clothes. She buys ladies’ and children’s clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sell them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a PKR 20,000 loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

She expects boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es: Carlos, a sus 63 años de edad, se dedica a la fabricación de artículos de aseo como escobas y trapeadoras, actividad que inició de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Trabaja solo todos los días, en un horario de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm o dependiendo de la cantidad de producción que debe entregar, ya que la elaboración es muy manual; de esta manera ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo quien ya pronto será abogado. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (madera, retazos de tela, alambre, entre otros), con el fin de abastecerse y tener el material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, y así aumentar sus ventas, lo que le ayudará a solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, pues su principal anhelo para un futuro cercano, es tecnificar su actividad para optimizar el tiempo de producción y así poder adquirir pedidos más grandes que le generen una mayor rentabilidad y estabilidad económica para disfrutar de un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos, 63 years old, is engaged in making cleaning implements such as brooms and mops, an activity he began empirically and that arose from the need to generate income to support his family.  He works alone every day from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm, depending on the amount of products that he must deliver since production is done manually.  In this way, he has managed to raise his son, who will soon be a lawyer.  Currently, he is requesting the help of this loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale supplies such as wood, scraps of cloth, wire, and other items.  His goal is to stock up and have the material available to make timely delivery of his pending orders.  Thus, he will increase his sales, which will help him pay for his basic household needs and continue investing in his business.  His main desire for the near future is to implement technology in his business in order to optimize production time.  This will enable him to acquire larger orders that generate higher profits and financial stability and enjoy better well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies such as wood, scraps of cloth, wire, and other items.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra, es una mujer que trabaja a diario para tener sus ingresos fijo, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y calzado nuevo, en su casa de habita, cansada de lavar y planchar ropa ajena decide poner este pequeño negocio con el apoyo de su esposo, ahora comparte más tiempo con su familia. Mayra solicita este crédito para abastecerse de nuevas prendas de ropa que le permitan aumentar las ventas, así mejorar su economía, para seguir manteniendo sus gastos del hogar, comprara chores, camisas, blusas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Mayra is a woman who works every day to have a steady income. She makes a living by selling new clothing and footwear from her home.

She was tired of washing and ironing other people's clothing, so she decided to open this small business with her husband's help. Now, she is able to spend more time with her family.

Mayra requests this loan to stock her business with new clothing styles that will allow her to improve sales, therefore improving her economic situation so that she can continue to pay for household expenses. She will purchase shorts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, and underwear.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, and underwear.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old, married, and supports two members of her family. She has been in the clothing  selling business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES.350,000. She operates her business in Kapsabet town. 

She has borrowed KES.105,000, and plans to use it to buy men suits, ladies suits, shoes, and children's wear to sell. 

She will use the profits from the business to buy a plot. Her dream is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy men suits, ladies suits, shoes, and children's wear to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has a grocery store in Kitengela town and has been in this business for five years. She is 29 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with one child. Right now she makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. These include mangoes, bananas, oranges, cabbages, onions, and tomatoes. She will use the anticipated profits to open another grocery business.

This is her first loan term and she hopes to have a successful business in future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is from Vanadzor. He lives with his wife and two little children, ages 6 and 4 years.

Over the past three years, Kamo has been earning his family's living by providing different renovation services to locals. Particularly he receives orders from individuals and provides them renovation service. Kamo perfectly manages to provide normal living conditions to his family. 

Now, this hard-working young man has applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for his work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will be a huge support for Kamo as he will be able to cover his current orders and gather income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing renovation services

loans.name: Saa'ed

texts.en:
Saa’ed is 38 years old; he lives in a village at Jenin with his wife and his two children, one of whom attends primary school. He works as a driver of a truck, distributing water in his town.

Saa’ed asks Ryada for this loan to buy electrical extensions for his house; this will be a step forward, because he has a  shortage in money so temporarily he lives now in a rented house until the house is ready. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy electrical extensions for his house

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas has a grocery business in Makueni town. She sells vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruits. She has been in this business for five years, and it has been profitable. She is 40 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. Right now her monthly income from her business is KES.5,000

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables, tomatoes, and onions to sell. This will enable her to meet her customers' needs, as well as make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her second loan term, and she paid her previous loan successfully. In future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is 48 years old, married to Peter, and they have been blessed with five children. She has a fruit and vegetable selling business that she has been running for the past four years. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables, oranges, bananas, mangos, and onions. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term, and her future hopes are to grow her business, provide for the needs of her family, as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 44-year-old married woman who has been doing business selling milk for many years. She has six calves and six cows to milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.

She is the mother of three children, and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, health, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. 

Now she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to purchase one more cow, and feed for its calves. 

She hopes to get an increase in the milk production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 39-years-old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married with 4 children between the ages of 4 and 20.  She has been selling rice and oil in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her aunt.  She enjoys the money she receives from her business everyday.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business.  Josephine hopes to improve her children's education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 57 años, es una mujer honesta, alegre y muy trabajadora, vive al lado de su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Elisa consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir de segunda, de distintos modelos y tallas para todas las edades, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, así mismo ofrece al público la mejor calidad de sábanas y toallas en diversos colores. Toda su mercadería la renueva de manera mensual, para ello viaja a otra ciudad donde encuentra todo lo necesario a precios mas baratos. Trabaja en este sector desde hace 10años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la facilidad que tiene de conseguir nuevos clientes, su carisma y su alegría le han permitido realizar buenas ventas en corto tiempo, por lo tanto el dinero que obtiene como ganancia es generado con mayor rapidez, además le permite organizar su tiempo y realizar las labores domésticas en su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por ropa de segunda como polos, shorts, pantalones, blusas, entre otros.
texts.en: Elisa, 57, is an honest, hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband and children in a house that they own.  Elisa operates a used clothing business.  She buys and sells clothing of all types and sizes, for both men and women.  She also sells good-quality sheets and towels.  She restocks her merchandise once a month, buying from a market in another town where she can buy the products she sells more cheaply.  She has operated the business for 10 years.  The most satisfying thing about the business, she says, is getting new customers.  Her charisma and good humor are her greatest assets and she has used her natural charm to build the business.  She adds that she makes money quickly, something that allows her to successfully split her time between the business and her family responsibilities.  Elisa is applying for a S/.1000 new soles loan that she will use to support her business.  She wants you to know that she is grateful for your support and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  The loan will go to buying bulk supplies of second-hand clothing--sports shirts, shorts, pants, blouses, etc.--that she will then resell.

loans.use: to stock her used clothing business.

loans.name: Rohama Group

texts.en:
These three farmers pictured are part of a Nuru International group of farmers called Rohama. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Charles, who is holding up his hand, is 62-years-old. He is married with eight children, four of whom are in school.  He solely depends on farming to earn a living and is, therefore, keen on practicing better farming methods.  During the 2014 long rains, Charles will plant a one acre farm, with maize in ½ acre and sorghum and millet in ¼ acre each.

He is therefore requesting a loan to enable him purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers. With these farm inputs, he is hopeful that the harvest will be good and he will be able to ensure food security for his family. He will sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for part of the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 35 years old and married, with three children. 

She is a business lady, and for the last two years she has been running a food cafe that has operated very well. She sells cooked food to her customers. 

She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy bundles of maize flour for her business. She hopes that in the next five years she will be running a successful restaurant in town. The challenge that she faces in her business is her customers failing to pay her in time. 

The income that she will raise will improve her standards of living and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of maize flour

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 26-years-old, married and lives in Buchanan with three children between the ages of one and ten-years-old. They live at home and two of her children attend school.  For the past five years now, she has run a shop where she sells used clothes in her community.  She is requesting a loan to buy used clothes for her business.  She hopes to build a house and help all her children.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old and single. She has one dependent whom she supports.

Beatrice was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer.  She runs a grocery business that has lasted for four years now, and it is located at Kijiwetanga.         In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 700. 

She is taking her first loan of KES 20,000, which she intends to use in adding stock to her business that includes tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals, peppers,  and cabbages.

Beatrice will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to have a bigger business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals, peppers, and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 45-year-old lady who lives in Buchanan with her husband and six children.  Three of her children are in school and the others are out of high school and living on their own.  For eighteen years now, she has been involved with her business.  Presently, she is selling palm oil, bitter-ball (eggplant-like vegetable), okra, pepper, etc. in the local market.  She was helped by her friends to start this business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, bitter-ball, okra, pepper, etc. for her business.  She hopes to build a new home for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, bitter-ball, okra, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de  21 años el cual tiene su negocio de venta de verduras en el mercado de su distrito, desde hace 2 años, con el fruto de su pequeño negocio puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque es padre de un pequeño de 1 año de edad al cual quiere muchísimo.
Miguel gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar mas verduras al por mayor con lo cual podrá atener mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida; así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio y darle una profesión a su hijo.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 21-year-old young man who has his own business selling vegetables in his district's market.  He has done this for two years.  With the fruit of his small business he is able to get the income to get ahead in life.  Most importantly, he is the father of a small one-year-old boy whom he loves very much.

Thanks to the support of the Kiva lenders, Miguel will be able to buy more wholesale vegetables which will give him more products to offer his customers.  This way he can improve his income and quality of life, and thus he will continue fighting to realize his great dream: "To have his own location for the shop and to provide a career for his son."

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Alpha is a group of five group-leader farmers in the Webuye District, with Wycliffe selected as the Kiva representative. 

Wycliffe has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 45 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349.
							
Wycliffe is 38 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years.  He works as a farmer to provide for his seven children.  The community and other farmers know Wycliffe as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community activities such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Wycliffe described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.	

Wycliffe first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Wycliffe joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send hs children to school.  

He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Wycliffe plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, buy a cow and a goat, and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  

Wycliffe’s own life was improved because he has more profits from his harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and was able to feed the family.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with small-holder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Wycliffe and the Alpha Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  

One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo, standing on the left.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase his harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives with her 9-year-old son in Yerevan. She is a divorced woman who does her best to provide her son with appropriate living conditions. Naira has been involved in the retail business for over a year. She rents a small space in one of the local markets and sells clothing and dress making accessories. She is very polite and kind with her customers and that's the reason she has a good client base. Currently, Naira asks for this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of clothing. As the winter has already come, there is high demand for winter clothing which Naira would like to purchase with the help of the loan. Naira has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Naira and she will be very thankful to lenders for their support.

Naira dreams of having her own shop and enlarging her business.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to resell it to customers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41-years-old and married to John.  Together they are blessed with children between the ages of 10 and 16-years-old. Jane has been into poultry farming for the past fourteen years, generating a monthly income of KES 70,000. 

She is borrowing her fourth loan of KES 60,000 with KADET LTD and plans to use the amount to buy chicks for rearing and chick feeds.

With the profits from the poultry business, she will use it on running her business. Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for rearing and chick feed.

loans.name: Flor Teresa

texts.es: Flor, a sus 31 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, un almacén de venta de ropa para bebés y niños, actividad que inició hace aproximadamente 10 meses, luego de adquirir experiencia en un almacén similar, en el que trabajó como vendedora durante varios años, trabaja sola todos los días de11:00 am a 8:00 pm y, de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía familiar y para velar por el bienestar de su hijo de 9 años de edad. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del préstamo para comprar surtido de mercancía al por mayor (ropa para bebés y niños, accesorios de cuidado para bebés, pañales, paños húmedos, colonias para bebés, entre otros) y para cancelar el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente, esto le permitirá ampliar la variedad de su portafolio de productos y así podrá satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada navideña, generándole un margen más alto de ganancias con lo que podrá hacerle frente a su principal desafío que es la competencia que existe en el sector donde se encuentra ubicada. De esta manera Flor podrá seguir avanzando y en un futuro próximo tener la capacidad de ampliar su negocio y diversificar su portafolio de productos, para ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos que le permiten brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus seres amados.
texts.en: Flor, 31, has a clothing business.  She sells clothing for infants and children, a business she started 10 months ago after working as a saleswoman for another clothing business.  The experience she gained before gave her the confidence to open her own store.  She works alone from 11:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening.  The business generates enough income to pay family expenses and provide for her 9-year old son.  Flor is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy bulk supplies of merchandise--clothing for infants and children, accessories, diapers, wipes, etc.--and the rest to pay off an older loan.  She wants to expand her product range and meet the increased demand that she expects over the coming holidays.  Buying in bulk will increase her profit margin and help her to meet her biggest challenge, namely, competition from many similar businesses.  The investment will help Flor improve her business and expand her product range, goals that will, in turn, provide her with more income for supporting her and her family.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Dúo Margaritas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: DLa encargada de este grupo es la señora Eufemia Margarita, quien desde hace tres años inicio su negocio, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo quien ha sido  de mucha ayuda para ella ella se dedica a la venta de ropa como pantalones, blusas, faldas  para dama, caballeros, niños, ropa de bebe, venta de regalos para toda ocasión, y calzado para damas.  Las fiestas navideñas se acercan y  es una fecha donde se obtienen muy buenas ganancias.  Le hace falta varias  cosas en el negocio y los clientes ya la están visitando y preguntando que ofertas tiene, por eso ella necesita comprar blusas, pantalones, faldas, camisas la cual es lo que el cliente mas está pidiendo pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y necesita tener un capital más grande para poder surtir  su negocio y tener lo que el cliente le está pidiendo y así aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.
texts.en:
The person in charge of this group is Señora Eufemia Margarita, who began her business three years ago.  She relies on the unconditional support of her husband, who has been of great help for her.  Señora Eufemia makes a living selling clothing like pants, shirts, skirts, clothing for women and men, and clothing for children.  She also sells gifts for every occasion and footwear for women.  

The Christmas celebrations are approaching, and that is a time in which she will make good profits.  She is lacking several things for the business and the customers are already visiting and asking what she has to offer.  This is why she needs to buy the shirts, pants, skirts, and t-shirts that her customers are most asking for but she does not have enough money.  She needs larger capital in order to be able to stock up her business and get what the customers are requesting, and thus take advantage of the end of year sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is an experienced farmer from Qarakert village of the Armavir region. He lives with his wife and school-aged son. Harutyun's wife works in the village's local school as a teacher. Her salary, however, is so low that she can hardly cover the daily basic needs of the family. 

Harutyun is engaged in cattle breeding, pig breeding, and cultivating tomatoes and apricots. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. Harutyun currently needs to make some investments in his agribusiness in order for it to function in a productive way. A loan of USD 1000 will help him a lot, enabling him to purchase some forage for the livestock. Harutyun and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage for livestock

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of five farmers called Nyota. It is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Esther, who is raising her hand, has been a member of this group for four years now. She is 70-years-old and married with six children. Only one of her children goes to school.

With the loan from Kiva, Esther plans to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet in a one acre farm. The harvest, which she hopes will be very good, will provide food security for her household.  She plans to sell the surplus and invest the money in a business to increase the family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Edwin Joel

texts.es:
Edwin vive en la ciudad de Tarapoto, ubicada en la selva peruana. Edwin tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo trabaja en una pequeña empresa como repartidor y vendedor, con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo puede salir, Edwin trabaja en su empleo desde hace un año y cree que le va bien porque es responsable.

Edwin está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, sobre todo porque ha habido muchas lluvias y con este apoyo podrá cambiar las calaminas de su techo y poder reforzar la puerta de la vivienda donde habita, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Poder tener una casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in the city of Tarapoto in the Peruvian jungle.  He very much wants to get ahead, so he works as a deliveryman and vendor in a small company.  With the income form his modest job he's able to get ahead.  Edwin has worked in his job for a year and he believes it's going well for him because he's responsible.

Edwin's grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to make improvements on his home, especially because there has been a lot of rain.  With this support he'll be able to change the corrugated metal on his roof and strengthen the door of the house he lives in.

This way he'll be able to improve his quality of life and continue striving to achieve his big dream of having a house made of quality materials.

loans.use: to improve the roof of his house

loans.name: Banco Mujer Buscando El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Doña Xinia es integrante de Banco Mujer Buscando El Triunfo, tiene 29 años, es madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad, y 3 de ellos cursan la primaria, vive en unión libre con el padre de sus hijos, quien trabaja como ayudante de construcción devengando un salario mínimo. Doña Xinia cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde desarrolla la siembra de plátano, y es ella misma quien prepara la tierra, cultiva y cuida de su cosecha. Este es el primer crédito que solicita y lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, bolsas plásticas y cajas de cartón.  Ella tiene muchos deseos de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y aumentar su patrimonio, mejorando la producción de sus cultivos. Junto a Doña Xinia integran el grupo 6 socias más que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y agropecuarias.
texts.en: Doña Xinia, 29, is a member of the Mujer Buscando El Triunfo community bank.  She and her partner have 4 young children, 3 of whom are in school.  Her partner makes a small income working construction, but it's not enough to support the family.  Doña Xinia has a small plot of land where she grows platanos.  She prepares the land herself, plants and tends her crop, and harvests what she grows.  This is her first loan application and she will use the money to buy seeds, organic manure, fertilizer, insecticides, plastic bags and cardboard boxes.  The business is her means of helping her family and she wants to make a success of it.  The other 6 members of the community bank pictured with Doña Xinia will invest in their own small businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and has two children, ages four and seven, who are attending school and live at home. For three years now, she has been selling dried and fresh fish in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  She is requesting a loan to purchase dried and fresh fish for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried and fresh fish  for her business,

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50 year-old married man from Gaza city.  He is a father of three sons and two daughters, all of whom are students.  For the past 13 years, Ali has been selling fruits and vegetables in the local market.  He buys seasonal crops from the local farmers and sells them.  It is a good business and earns a good income. 
Ali took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his business by adding more shelves for his shop.  This will allow him to present more products to the clients.  By taking this loan, Ali's project will improve and his income will increase. 
Ali appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to improve his business by adding more shelves for his shop

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 24-year-old single young man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a very humble house. For the past few years, Nidal has been working operating a small bulldozer that he owns. He works in the construction workshops, but his income is not stable due to fluctuations in demand. Nidal works very hard to ensure good living conditions. 

Nidal requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to fix his bulldozer wheels, as he doesn't have enough cash to do it. This will help him to get back to work and also raise his productivity. Nidal would like to take another loan in the future and maybe buy a new bulldozer for his work.
 
Nidal appears in the photo in front of his bulldozer

loans.use: to fix his bulldozer wheels so he can get back to work.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is progressing well in her business.  She now supports six people in her family. She has borrowed a loan of KES. 50,000  with which she intends  to expand her new grocery business. She anticipates getting profits which she will use to expand her milk and grocery businesses.

Also, she hopes to give the best education to her children as well as expanding her milk sales business into a processing plant.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 36 years old, a female and married. She has four children: ten, eight, three, and two years old, respectively, whom which she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a Kadet officer.  She has a tailoring shop which has lasted for three years now, and it is located at Marereni.  In her business she earns a monthly income of ksh.5050. She is taking her second loan of ksh.20,000, which she intends to use in adding stock to her business by buying materials, zips, sewing threads and canvas. Esther will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her previous loan of ksh.20,000 was repaid successfully. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to expand her tailoring shop and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy  materials, zips, sewing threads and canvas to make clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Mohima

texts.en:
Mohima is from a remote region, Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a 38-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in their own small kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made). Both Mohima and her husband, Safiar, age 50 years, are uneducated and can only sign their names. Their children are receiving education, and they read in class III (grade 3) and class II (grade 2) respectively.

Mohima's husband is a cycle-van puller. He earns money by carrying goods and people in his van. Mohima is also engaged in cattle breeding to take care of the family's needs. Unfortunately, their earnings are not enough to cover their daily needs.

She has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow to start a milk supply business in the locality to generate more income. This business is very lucrative and has a great demand in their locality and in the present market. Moreover, they will be able to get the cow dung, which is used as fertilizer in rural areas.

Her main interest is to continue fighting for her family's well-being and to give their children a better education, which is why she will continue to work hard in order to make her dreams come true.

Her dream is to buy another cycle van with the profit from her business in order to rent them for another means of income.

Mohima is thankful to BJS and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Monjuma

texts.en:
Monjuma is a rural housewife. She is only 21 years old. She lives with her husband and only son in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband Nobivil, aged 27 years, is engaged in farming. Monjuma received education up to class V (grade 5), and her husband received education up to class IV (grade 4). Their son is below the school-going age. They have a small kachha house (bamboo, straw and mud-made).

Monjuma's husband earns his income by selling different crops in the local market. It is the main source of income with which they can cover the household necessities.

Monjuma wanted to contribute to the family with her own business. So, she has taken a loan to start a business of potato cultivation. She will use the loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes on their own small piece of land and sell them in the local market. As there is a huge demand for potatoes in the local market, she hopes to earn enough profits from her business.

Monjuma dreams to increase the amount of her cultivation to upgrade her family financially, prepare her son academically and have many opportunities and options in life.

She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Galenur

texts.en:
Galenur is a 24-year-old married woman. She is a housewife and illiterate. She can only sign her name. Her husband is Nur, 30 years old, who is associated with the vegetable business, Nur cultivates different types of vegetables and sells them to the local market. He also has no education but can sign his name. They have an only son of two and half years old and he is too small to go to school. They live in the small village East Alta Gram of Magurmari in Dhupguri district.

Galenur assists her husband in his work. Now they plan to grow lauki (bottle gourd) in their land.  She learned about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and applied for a loan to buy seeds and manure. She is hopeful that the cultivation will be very profitable as there is a great demand for lauki in the local market. Sometimes lauki crops get damaged due to insects, so they want good quality manure to protect their crops from insects. 

Galenur's husband’s income from his business is 5000 INR per month. His earnings are not enough to provide sustenance to their family, but she hopes to earn a more profit from her business with which she will be able to meet the financial needs of her family. She plans to take this loan to grow bottle gourds, and hopes that with the profits, one day she will be able to buy a tractor to help with all of their agriculture needs. 

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and manure for cultivating lauki (bottle gourd)

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Matete is a group of nine group leader farmers in Matete District.  Joyce has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 74 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Joyce is married and has four children.  She is 35 years old and is known as friendly, and hardworking, and trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, and prayer group.  Joyce has been a farmer for 12 years.  Joyce described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Joyce first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Joyce joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers.  Joyce plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, and save for the future, and buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Joyce’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, and has more farm training, and was able to save money.  
							
Joyce and the Matete Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.
							
Please note that there are 3 additional group leaders in this photo that will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Erastus' Group

texts.en:
Agape is a group of nine group leader farmers in Webuye District with Erastus selected as the Kiva representative. Erastus has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is pictured on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 85 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Erastus is married and has 13 children. He is 51 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Erastus has been a farmer for 22 years. Erastus described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Erastus first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Erastus joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, is an active community member, wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Erastus plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, save for the future, and buy a goat. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Erastus’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and was able to feed the family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Erastus and the Agape Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

Please note that there is one additional group leader in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Christmas

texts.en:
Christmas is 44 years old and wants a loan to buy more produce to sell.

He deals in produce and owns a store located in a busy trading centre in Hoima district, Uganda. His clients are the Naseco seed company. He earns additional income from farming. His dream is to expand his business into new markets. He is challenged by the weather changes, especially the prolonged drought in Hoima.

loans.use: buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is from Stepanavan town. She lives with her children who are aged 19 and 26. 

For eight years, Lia has been involved in a retail business. She sells clothing and dressmaking supplies and earns income for her children. Lia feels very responsible to provide her children with normal living conditions. She works hard and due to her kind attitude her clients value the service she provides. 

Now, this woman needs financial support. She has requested this loan to purchase new stock of clothing. Lia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support to Lia and she will be very grateful for that.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to re-sell to her clients.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 25-year-old single man who works in providing internet services to his Palestinian camp citizens. Husein is a Palestinian refugee who works hard at developing himself and his business in a well-managed way. He and other Palestinian refugees work hard to achieve their goals within the Lebanese rules concerning education and work.

Husein has run his internet station since eight years ago. Husein is working hard on improving his socioeconomic situation.  That's why he is, at the current time, focusing on starting his own family.
Husein is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for his engagement expenses.  That is the first step forward towards making his own small family.
This is Husein's fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  He has a good history of paying back his previous loans, which were invested in developing his business with necessary hardware and software.

loans.use: To pay for his engagement expenses, which is the first step forward towards making his own small family.

loans.name: Adline

texts.en:
Adline is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married with five children between the ages of 20 and 36. 

Adline has been selling pepper, salt and oil, etc in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys the money she receives from her business every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, salt and oil, etc. for her business. In the future she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, salt and oil etc. for her business.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is a member of Kosiana Group in Chwele District.  She is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 54 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Eunice has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Eunice is 32 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years.  The community and other farmers know Eunice as friendly, and hardworking, and reliable, and trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community such as the women's group, and savings group, and prayer group.  Eunice described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Eunice first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2008 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Eunice joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Eunice plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to repair the home, and save for the future, and buy a cow, and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Eunice’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, and has more farm training, and was able to save money.  							

Eunice and the Kosiana Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet Ramatu. She is a 50-year-old from the Jui Eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 10 and 30. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 1987, Ramatu established a general merchandise business within a busy market area. She began her business because she wanted to change her standard of living. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is having insufficient finances to expand her business.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase biscuits, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Ramatu plans to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Mini

texts.en:
Mini is 36 years old married, with three children. She is a housewife and lives with her husband and children in their kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made).  They are from the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. 

Mini attended school up to class V (grade 5), and her husband, Moktar, who is 40 years old, received education up to class VIII (grade 8). All of their children are receiving education. They read in class X (grade 10), class IX (grade 9) and class VI (grade 6) respectively.

Mini's husband earns income by selling betel nuts (used as breath fresheners), which are grown on their land. He sells betel nuts in the local market and earns money to run their family.

The earnings from his work were too low to run a family of five members. So, Mini decided to take a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start growing potatoes.

Mini hopes that this business will provide them sufficient financial support, as potatoes are in great demand in the local market because they are the main vegetable used by the local people. The profit will upgrade their poor financial condition and help them to give better education to their children.

Their future plan is to buy a cycle-van with the profit from her business to carry their products to the local market; at the same time, they will offer it for rent for another means of income.

They are grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Sinta

texts.en:
Sinta is only 20 years old and has no elementary school education due to her parents' lack of sufficient resources for her to continue. She is married to Nagendra, aged 22 years, who is also illiterate and can only sign his name. They have one son and one daughter. Both the children are below the school-going age. They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw) in a small village in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Sinta's husband is a farmer by profession. He has an inherited plot of land where he grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells those vegetables in the local market. Sinta also wants to help her husband, and she is also involved in the field activities. 

She has taken a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizes to start potato cultivation. She hopes to harvest more crops so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living. The product is in good demand in the local market, and it is a very profitable business, too.

Sinta has a goal to increase her production and income, so that she can continue to provide financial support to her family and her children's well-being. She hopes to buy a cycle-van in the future with the profit from her business in order to carry vegetables in the market.

Her full thanks go to BJS and to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Ahima

texts.en:
Ahima is a 50-year-old woman. She is a housewife and received no education, but she can sign her name. She has two sons. Her husband, Hapizar, is 62 years old. He is also not literate but can sign his name. Their children are also engaged in the family business. They live in Baromaria at Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.

Her source of income is from cultivating potatoes. She lives in a kaccha (straw and mud) house but has her own plot of land. She wants to buy more potato seeds, fertilizers, manure and other necessary equipment for growing potatoes. 

She applied for a loan from BJS so she can grow potatoes and sell them in the market for a great profit. She is eager to take the loan as selling potatoes is a profitable business. She hopes she will be able to overcome her financial problems.

Ahima is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase good quality seeds and manure for growing potatoes

loans.name: Aesha

texts.en:
Aesha is 32 years old. She is a housewife and studied up to class IV. Her husband is Chhamchhul, 40 years. He is engaged in agricultural work. He studied up to class V. They have three children, a son and two daughters. They all are studying in class X, IX and VII respectively. They live in Madhya Boragadi.

Aesha‘s income is too low to meet the expenses incurred in a family. She provides education to all her children with great difficulty. Sometimes many problems arise in growing potatoes due to pesticides but she cannot overcome them due to her poor income.

As potatoes are a profitable crop, Aesha hopes to increase her potato-growing business. So she wants to take a loan from BJS to buy more potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes in a huge amount. She also dreams of a concrete house in future with the profit from her business.

She will be thankful to BJS for the loan which will help her to live a better life with her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and manure for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Tisinye B Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of three farmers called Tisinye B and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand in the picture is Julius. He is 69 years old, and is married with five children who all go to school. Julius has been a member of this group for four years now and has benefitted from being educated on various ways to improve farming methods. He is very excited about the 2014 long rains season.

Julius has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains season. He is however constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase these farm inputs. Julius believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields and he will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Elija's Group

texts.en:
Nehema is a group of nine group leader farmers in Matete District.  Elija has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 88 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Elija is married and has seven children.  He is 55 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, and prayer group .  Elija has been a farmer for 19 years.  Elija described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Elija first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Elija joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and fertilizer.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  Elija plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Elija’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and was able to feed his family.  							

Elija and the Nehema Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

Please note that there is 1 additional group leader in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Shohmahmad

texts.ru:
Шохмахмад начинает свой бизнес по выпечке хлебов. Ему 64 года. У него жена, дети и внуки. У Шохмахмада очень большая семья. В его семье живут 12 человек. Шохмахмад как глава семьи всегда думает о благополучии семьи.               
В течение нескольких лет Шохмахмад работал на хлебзаводе и накопил достаточного опыта. Теперь он хочет открыть свою хлебопекарню. Шохмахмад планирует производить хлеб и сдавать их оптом в магазины города. Также дополнительно для свадеб и других мероприятий он будет выпекать по заказу национальные большие и маленькие лепешки. Он планирует взять одного работника в свою пекарню и будет платить ему каждый месяц зарплату. Шохмахмад уже составил свой бизнес план. Для реализации своих намеченных планов Шохмахмад просит кредит. Он собирается приобрести большую печь для хлебовыпечки.
texts.en: Shohmahmad is starting a business for baking bread. He is 64 years old. He has a wife, children and grandchildren.  Shohmahmad has a very large family. There are 12 people in his family. As the head of the family, Shohmahmad is always thinking about the family's well-being. For several years, Shohmahmad worked in a bakery and has gained sufficient experience. Now, he wants to open his own bakery. Shohmahmad plans to bake bread and deliver it to wholesale shops in the city. Additionally, he will bake large and small loaves for weddings and other special events. He plans to hire one employee for his bakery and will pay him a monthly salary. Shohmahmad has already created his business plan. In order to realize his plans, Shohmahmad has requested a loan. He is going to get a big oven for baking bread.

loans.use: to purchase a large oven for baking bread

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a married woman. She is 27 years old and a housewife. She is married to Giren, who is 35 years old. They have one son and two daughters. They are providing education to their two children with great difficulty. They are in class VIII (grade 8) and class III (grade 3). The third one is below school-going age.  

They are from the small village of East Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have a semi-pacca house (brick walls and straw roof).

Ratna's husband is engaged in the business of supplying wood. He supplies wood for constructing the structure of a house. He collects wood from their village and from the neighboring villages and supplies it to the contractors in their area. In this way, he earns for their family. But his small income is not sufficient to maintain a family of five members nowadays, when the prices of the necessary things are going up day by day.

Ratna has taken a loan from BJS to help her husband to purchase more wood. She is hopeful to expand the business with the loan and to earn extra profit to overcome the financial hurdles of her family.

Her dreams are to upgrade their poor financial condition, give better education to their children to secure their future and buy a cycle-van to carry firewood. They can also offer the van for hire, which will be another means of income.

Ratna is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wood for expanding the existing business.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафрузу 23 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Дилафруз живет в сельской местности и поэтому она как другие местные жители занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур как овощи и зерновые культуры. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Дилафруз работает упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Она очень трудолюбивая. Дилафруз и ее муж планируют отремонтировать их дом, так как их дом имеет плохое состояние.
